cboCostEstimates.description: As ordered reported by the House Committee on Veterans’ Affairs on April 6, 2022
cboCostEstimates.title: H.R. 6064, a bill to direct the Secretary of Veterans Affairs to seek to enter into an agreement with the National Academies of Sciences, Engineering, and Medicine for a review of examinations, furnished by the Secretary, to individuals who submit claims

constitutionalAuthorityStatementText:
[Congressional Record Volume 167, Number 202 (Friday, November 19, 2021)]
[House]
From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]
By Mr. NEHLS:
H.R. 6064.
Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuant
to the following:
Article 1, Section 8, clause 1 of the United States
Constitution
[Page H6670]
title: To direct the Secretary of Veterans Affairs to seek to enter into an agreement with the National Academies of Sciences, Engineering, and Medicine for a review of examinations, furnished by the Secretary, to individuals who submit claims to the Secretary for compensation under chapter 11 of title 38, United States Code, for mental and physical conditions linked to military sexual trauma.
